byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and NICHOLAS CONFESSORE

lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton will begin personally courting donors for a super PAC supporting her candidacy, the first time a Democratic presidential candidate has fully embraced the groups.

headline.print_headline: Clinton Embraces a ‘Super PAC,’ Trying to Erode a G.O.P. Edge
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Embraces a ‘Super PAC,’ Trying to Erode a Republican Edge

snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton will begin personally courting donors for a super PAC supporting her candidacy, the first time a Democratic presidential candidate has fully embraced the groups.
abstract: Hillary Clinton is poised to become first Democratic presidential candidate to embrace super PAC campaign money, aiming to level playing field with Republican contenders who already reap benefits of unlimited funds from outside groups; move ups ante in 2016 presidential race that is sure to be most costly in history of American politics.
